Bengaluru Braces For Harsh Summer: Intense Heat Likely For 2 Months
Last Updated:
This year’s summer is expected to be severe across the state, with temperatures in North Karnataka likely to touch 47°C. The IMD has also warned of rising heat levels in Bengaluru.

The state is likely to face a harsh summer this year, with temperatures in some regions expected to rise up to 3°C above normal. The heat season has also arrived earlier than usual.
